verses.verse: And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Yet will I bring<WH935> one<WH259> plague<WH5061> more upon Pharaoh<WH6547>, and upon Egypt<WH4714>; afterwards<WH310> he will let you go<WH7971> hence: when he shall let you go<WH7971>, he shall surely<WH1644> thrust you out<WH1644> hence altogether<WH3617>.

Speak<WH1696> now in the ears<WH241> of the people<WH5971>, and let every man<WH376> borrow<WH7592> of his neighbour<WH7453>, and every woman<WH802> of her neighbour<WH7468>, jewels<WH3627> of silver<WH3701>, and jewels<WH3627> of gold<WH2091>.

And the LORD<WH3068> gave<WH5414> the people<WH5971> favour<WH2580> in the sight<WH5869> of the Egyptians<WH4714>. Moreover the man<WH376> Moses<WH4872> was very<WH3966> great<WH1419> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, in the sight<WH5869> of Pharaoh's<WH6547> servants<WH5650>, and in the sight<WH5869> of the people<WH5971>.
And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559>, Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068>, About midnight<WH3915><WH2676> will I go out<WH3318> into the midst<WH8432> of Egypt<WH4714>:

And all the firstborn<WH1060> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714> shall die<WH4191>, from the firstborn<WH1060> of Pharaoh<WH6547> that sitteth<WH3427> upon his throne<WH3678>, even unto the firstborn<WH1060> of the maidservant<WH8198> that is behind<WH310> the mill<WH7347>; and all the firstborn<WH1060> of beasts<WH929>.
And there shall be<WH1961> a great<WH1419> cry<WH6818> throughout all the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>, such as there was none<WH3808> like it, nor<WH3808> shall be like it any more<WH3254>.

But against any of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> shall not a dog<WH3611> move<WH2782> his tongue<WH3956>, against man<WH376> or beast<WH929>: that ye may know<WH3045> how that the LORD<WH3068> doth put a difference<WH6395> between the Egyptians<WH4714> and Israel<WH3478>.

And all these thy servants<WH5650> shall come down<WH3381> unto me, and bow down<WH7812> themselves unto me, saying<WH559>, Get thee out<WH3318>, and all the people<WH5971> that follow<WH7272> thee: and after<WH310> that I will go out<WH3318>. And he went out<WH3318> from Pharaoh<WH6547> in a great<WH2750> anger<WH639>.
And the LORD<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, Pharaoh<WH6547> shall not hearken<WH8085> unto you; that my wonders<WH4159> may be multiplied<WH7235> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>.

And Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> did<WH6213> all these wonders<WH4159> before<WH6440> Pharaoh<WH6547>: and the LORD<WH3068> hardened<WH2388> Pharaoh's<WH6547> heart<WH3820>, so that he would not let the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> go out<WH7971> of his land<WH776>.
